Install Sigrepo Database Locally

Source: vignettes/install-sigrepo-locally.Rmd
install-sigrepo-locally.Rmd

Software requirements

  • Git version >= 2.21
  • Docker version >= 20.10

Don’t have Git installed, see Git Guides

Don’t have Docker installed, download a Docker Engine that is compatible with your machine

NOTE: may need to restart your computer for Docker to kicks-in

  • Check if Docker is installed
docker --version
  • Check if Docker Compose is installed
docker compose version

Set-up

  1. Clone this repository and navigate to SigRepo folder
git clone https://github.com/montilab/SigRepo
cd SigRepo
  1. Create a mysql.env file to initiate database and users in MySQL database
MYSQL_DATABASE='sigrepo'
MYSQL_USER='admin'
MYSQL_PASSWORD='admin'
MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD='123456'

IMPORTANT NOTES:

  • We will use a base MySQL image to initiate the database. Please see the official image here for more details about a list of the environment variable that it allows.

  • Environment variables above are just dummy values. Please changes to more encrypted values.

  1. Create a network db-net to host MySQL locally
docker network create -d bridge db-net
  1. Edit docker-compose.yml to configure how to build MySQL image and run its container.
  • Map the MySQL directory you created in (3) to the container /var/lib/mysql directory.
  • Map the MySQL schema initiation script (init.sql) stored in SigRepo/inst/mysql/schema directory to the container /docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/init.sql directory in order to initiate the database tables and schema. 
services:
  sigrepo-mysql:
    container_name: sigrepo-mysql
    image: sigrepo-mysql:latest
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile-mysql
      args:
        - mysql_image=mysql:8.0-bookworm
    env_file:
      - mysql.env
    volumes:
      - /montilab-p/mysql/database:/var/lib/mysql:rw
      - /montilab-p/SigRepo/inst/mysql/schema/init.sql:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/init.sql:rw
    networks:
      - db-net
    ports:
      - 3306:3306
    restart: always
      
networks:
  db-net:
    external: true
  1. Build MySQL image and run its container
docker compose up -d

-d: run container in detached mode

  1. Check if the container is built successfully
docker ps


CONTAINER ID   IMAGE                  COMMAND                    CREATED        STATUS        PORTS                    NAMES
b37b6b19c4e8   sigrepo-mysql:latest   "docker-entrypoint.s..."   5 hours ago    Up 5 hours    0.0.0.0:3306->3838/tcp   sigrepo-mysql
  1. Create an .Renviron file with all credentials to access the database and store it in your $HOME or Project directory.
DBNAME = "sigrepo"
HOST = "127.0.0.1"
PORT = 3306
USER = "root"
PASSWORD = "123456"

NOTES: 127.0.0.1 is the localhost IP address.

  1. Connect to MySQL server from your local RStudio Server using .Renviron created in (8)
# For DB connection
library(RMySQL)
library(DBI)

## Establish database connection
conn <- DBI::dbConnect(
  drv = RMySQL::MySQL(),
  dbname = Sys.getenv("DBNAME"), 
  host = Sys.getenv("HOST"), 
  port = as.integer(Sys.getenv("PORT")), 
  user = Sys.getenv("USER"), 
  password = Sys.getenv("PASSWORD")
)
